etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Bell's Life in London and Sporting Chronicle. From funk + -er

definitions: A person who funks; a coward; Horse Riding a rider who tends to shy at or avoid a jump, fence, etc.

notes.text: "hard funker" noun a rider who is frightened of jumping but who rides at a jump, fence, etc., in a plucky, fearless, or even reckless manner.
